title: Vibrant Black Apostolic & Holiness visual restyle (styling-only, no content/route changes)

requirements.summary: Apply a consistent vibrant Black Apostolic & Holiness-inspired theme across all public pages (palette, surfaces, typography, buttons/links, cards, special blocks) without changing content or navigation.
acceptanceCriteria: All public pages share a consistent visual language (palette, section surfaces, headings, buttons, cards).
The look clearly shifts toward a richer, more celebratory church aesthetic (deeper dark surfaces + warm metallic accents + vibrant highlights) without changing page content or navigation structure.
No user-facing text is changed as part of the restyle (styling-only update).

file_operations.description: Update global theme tokens and component classes to establish a near-black + warm gold + rich warm accent system, and to ensure consistent styling across nav/sections/cards/typography/buttons/links/special blocks (styling-only).
Adjust typography component classNames to better match the new celebratory palette (e.g., headings using gold/accent treatments where appropriate) while keeping text content unchanged.
Ensure section background variants map cleanly to the updated surface tokens (no content/layout changes; styling-only consistency improvements).
Align card/title/metadata styling with updated theme classes/tokens (no text or structure changes; styling-only).

requirements.summary: Revise Tailwind theme tokens and custom utility classes in frontend/src/index.css for deeper dark surfaces, warm gold accents, vibrant secondary highlights, special block treatments, and accessible contrast.
acceptanceCriteria: CSS variables under :root and .dark are updated to a cohesive palette that reads as near-black + gold + warm/vibrant accents (not a blue/purple-led look).
Buttons (.btn-primary/.btn-secondary), links (.link-default), and navigation link states (.nav-link/.nav-link-active) remain readable with clear hover/focus states.
Scripture and highlight blocks (.scripture-block, .event-highlight) look more “special” (e.g., stronger border treatment/gradient/texture accent) while staying readable.
No changes are made to any immutable frontend paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.

file_operations.description: Retune :root/.dark CSS variables to a near-black base with warm metallic (gold) accents and non-blue/purple-led highlights; update .btn-primary/.btn-secondary/.link-default/.nav-link/.nav-link-active for accessible hover/focus states; enhance .scripture-block and .event-highlight with richer border/gradient/texture accents while maintaining readability. (Do not change any user-facing text.)
If needed to support the updated CSS variable token set, confirm/extend Tailwind mappings for any new/adjusted semantic tokens used by the restyle (no new dependencies, no route/content changes).

requirements.summary: Restyle header and footer to match the new theme with elevated dark surfaces/gradients, improved active link styling, and tasteful celebratory accents; keep all routes/labels unchanged.
acceptanceCriteria: SiteNav retains the same links/labels and behavior, but visually matches the new theme (background, borders, hover/active states).
SiteFooter matches the header style and theme palette and remains readable.
Desktop and mobile navigation remain functional and visually coherent after restyling.

file_operations.description: Update header surface treatment (e.g., subtle gradient, refined border/shadow), improve active/hover/focus styles using existing nav-link classes/tokens, and add tasteful accent details while keeping links/labels/behavior unchanged.
Restyle footer to visually pair with the updated header (dark elevated surface, warm accent headings/links, readable contrast) without changing any labels, routes, or content.
Ensure header/hero/mobile CTA buttons remain readable and consistent with updated .btn-* styles (no link/label changes).

requirements.summary: Enhance the Home page hero presentation with a richer, more dramatic overlay and improved contrast while keeping existing hero layout and CTAs intact.
acceptanceCriteria: The hero overlay (currently a primary gradient overlay) is updated to better fit the new palette and improve legibility of the hero title/subtitle.
Primary CTAs remain visible and readable on the hero across common screen sizes.
No route changes; Home page structure remains the same.

file_operations.description: Swap hero background image to the warmed/celebratory version and update the overlay treatment (e.g., near-black + warm-gold tint gradient) to improve legibility while keeping the hero layout and CTAs unchanged. Use frontend/public/assets/generated/kmi-hero-holiness.dim_1920x800.png.
Add the edited hero image asset (generated from kmi-hero.dim_1920x800.png) as a static frontend asset.

requirements.summary: Introduce reusable subtle “flair” elements (ornamental divider/texture overlay) as static assets and apply them sparingly to hero, section headers, and special blocks without clutter.
acceptanceCriteria: At least one reusable decorative element is introduced and used consistently (not randomly) across multiple pages/sections.
Decorative elements do not reduce text readability or interfere with interactions (links/buttons still easy to use).
All decorative assets are served as static frontend assets (not via the backend).

file_operations.description: Add the generated ornamental gold divider flourish (transparent background) as a static frontend asset.
Add the generated seamless dark texture tile as a static frontend asset.

Create reusable decorative utility/component classes that reference frontend/public/assets/generated/holiness-divider.dim_1600x200.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/holiness-texture-tile.dim_1024x1024.png (e.g., subtle texture overlay class and ornamental divider treatment) and apply them to special blocks and key surfaces without impacting readability or interactions.

Apply a consistent, sparing decorative treatment to section headings (e.g., an ornamental divider rendered via a class/pseudo-element) so it appears across multiple pages without changing any heading text.
Enhance ScriptureBlock and EventHighlight to use the new decorative/texture classes so these blocks feel more “special” while keeping their content and structure unchanged.
Apply the decorative/texture flair classes sparingly within the existing hero and/or key section areas (no layout/CTA changes), ensuring the ornamentation is consistent with other pages/sections.
